details.title: Can Congress stop BJP juggernaut?
details.content:
Assam, in one way, is a vital state for both parties. For the BJP, the state is important not just for the party organisation but also for party ideology – the National Register of Citizens or NRC is its flagship ideological programme.

For the Congress, which is losing almost everywhere, the return to power will give the party much-needed oxygen. (READ MORE)

details.title: Assam daily COVID cases cross 3400 on Saturday
details.content: Ahead of D-day, Assam added 3,453 more people positive for the virus on Saturday, while 23 fresh fatalities took the death toll to 1,330, the National Health Mission said in a bulletin.

details.title: Assam Exit Polls 2021
details.content: As Per the Post Poll Survey conducted by 'Peoples Pulse', BJP would get 43-48 seats and the Congress seems to attempt to be closing in with 38-43 seats. (READ MORE)

Counting of votes for #AssamAssemblyPolls to be held at two locations in Dibrugarh, at Dibrugarh Govt Boys Higher Secondary School and Deputy Commissioner Office, Dibrugarh.

Visuals from both locations as counting to begin at 8 am.#AssemblyElections2021 pic.twitter.com/UXX0CNAtBp

— ANI (@ANI) May 2, 2021

details.title: Fearing horse-trading by BJP, Congress shepherds Assam candidates
details.content:
With the day of the results drawing near, the Congress has shepherded its Assam candidates to a resort at picturesque Sonapur on the outskirts of Guwahati.

The basic idea is to keep the flock together and away from poachers.  (READ MORE)

details.title: Counting of votes begin!
details.content:
The counting of votes for 126 assembly seats in Assam for which polling was held in three phases began on Sunday in 34 districts amid tight security measures.

In all, 946 candidates including 74 female candidates of different political parties including Bharatiya Janata Party and Congress contested the elections.

details.title: One reserved unused EVM found in trunk ahead of counting day
details.content:
One reserved unused Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) was found inside a trunk at a counting centre in Assam's Hailakandi on Saturday evening, a day before the counting of polls are scheduled to begin.

As per a statement, District Election Officer Megh Nidhi Dahal along with returning officers rushed to the spot where the EVM was detected and made an inquiry into it. The contesting candidates also reached the spot.

"On being investigated, it was found that the unused EVM inside a trunk that found its way inadvertently to the counting venue was a reserved one and there were no votes polled therein," the statement said, adding that it was open before the contesting candidates, who were satisfied with the results. (ANI)

As we take a large lead in the seats in early counting, I urge all @BJP4Assam Karyakartas to refrain from crowded celebrations as mandated by @ECISVEEP & endorsed by @BJP4India Nat'l President @JPNadda Ji. Let us be humble & maintain Assam's excellent track record managing #covid

details.title: NDA surges ahead of Congress-led Grand Alliance in Assam
details.content:
BJP candidates are leading in 54 seats, while those of its ally AGP in 10 and UPPL in seven.

The Congress has established leads in 26 places and AIUDF in 10. (READ MORE)

Congress Legislative Party chief Debabrata Saikia is trailing in Nazira

details.content:
Election Commission of India writes to Chief Secretaries to 'prohibit victory celebrations urgently.' (ANI) pic.twitter.com/65BvG6Wynh

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) May 2, 2021

This is the result of the support of the people. We have to wait till the vote-counting is complete but the trend shows that the people are on our side, says CM Sonowal.

(ANI)

details.title: Vote share percentage data, according to EC
Congress confident of victory despite trends indicating BJP's comeback
details.content: All India Congress Committee National General Secretary Jitendra Singh said the trends so far will be reversed in the next two to four hours. "I am still saying that the 'Mahajot' will form the government. Only 3-4 rounds are over at this moment, while counting will continue for more than 15 rounds in most of the seats," said Singh, the in-charge of Assam Congress.

details.title: Himanta Biswa Sarma wins Jalukbari
details.content:
Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has retained his seat from Jalukbari constituency with a margin of 1,01,911 votes.

@BJP4India won Jalukbari LAC-by a margin of 1,01,911 votes.

It would be my Privilege to represent the constituency for 5th consecutive term.

My gratitude to the people of Jalukbari,Honble PM @narendramodi , HM @AmitShah and national president @JPNadda

JAI AAI ASOM,JAI HIND

— Himanta Biswa Sarma (@himantabiswa) May 2, 2021

details.title: More wins for BJP
details.content: BJP state president Ranjeet Kumar Dass and Minister Chandra Mohan Patowary win

details.title: Assam Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal wins from Majuli
details.content: Sonowal won from Majuli constituency with a margin of almost 18,000 votes, defeating INC's Rajib Lochan Pegu

details.title: Jailed activist Akhil Gogoi wins from Sivasagar
details.content: Jailed activist Akhil Gogoi wins from Sivasagar seat. Lurinjyoti Gogoi loses in both seats

details.title: Defeat for 3 BPF ministers
details.content: All three ministers of Bodoland People's Front defeated

details.title: BJP's Himanta Biswa Sarma wins by over 1 lakh vote, defeats Congress' Romen Chandra Borthaku
details.content:
• Senior Assam minister Himanta Biswa Sarma of the BJP on Sunday defeated Romen Chandra Borthakur of the Congress by 1,01,911 votes to retain Jalukbari constituency, an official said.
  • In the outgoing government of Assam, Sarma held portfolios of education, health, finance and public works department (PWD).

details.title: Lates trends show BJP leading in 77 of 126 seats in Assam
details.content: Looks like BJP is all set to form government for second consecutive term in Assam as trends show the Saffron party leading in 77 of 126 assembly constituencies.

details.title: Himanta Biswa Sarma: Man of the Match of the Assam elections
details.content:
Five years ago, he came and not only contributed to building the prowess of the BJP in Assam but also hoisted the party's flag across the Northeast. Now, on a day when the BJP has retained power in Assam, Himanta Biswa Sarma can pat himself once again. 
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Notable winners in Assam Assembly Elections 2021
details.content:
• Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal
  • BJP ministers Himanta Biswa Sarma, Parimal Suklabaidya
  • BJP state president Ranjeet Kumar Dass
  • Speaker Hitendra Nath Goswami
  • Raijor Dal president Akhil Gogoi
  • AGP chief Atul Bora

details.title: Assam Congress chief Ripun Bora tenders resignation to Sonia Gandhi
details.content: “I do hereby tender my resignation from the post of president, Assam Pradesh Congress Committee owning the responsibility of humiliating defeat of my party…Madam, I am extremely saddened and disheartened to inform you that despite my immense hard work, we were unable to combat the divisive and communal politics played by the BJP-RSS,” Ripu Bora wrote in his resignation letter to Congress president Sonia Gandhi.
